metadata.title: CVE-2023-50387 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4033, 4034, 4035, 6840,and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. Oneof the concerns is that, when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIGrecords, the protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluateall combinations of DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
isc-dhcp package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
unbound package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
dnsmasq package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
pdns-recursor package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
knot-resolver package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
